slides.notes: After this topic, you will be able to: Understand the role of protocols in networking; Explain the reason for a layered architecture; Describe the OSI model in relation to layers, functions, protocols, and devices; Identify the five layers of the TCP/IP model.
Protocols define rules for communication. They dictate how data can be exchanged between devices and are maintained by organizations like IEEE and ANSI.

topics.title: Role of Protocols
keyPoints: Protocols establish rules for data communication.
Protocols are logical and ensure smooth data exchange between devices.

topics.title: OSI and TCP/IP Models
keyPoints: The OSI model provides a structured approach for designing network protocols.
TCP/IP has five layers, focusing on interoperability across various devices.
